intro: Cyperus incomtus var. venturii, commonly known as the narrowleaf flatsedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and along riverbanks. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread vegetatively and establish in moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
